By Hannah Boyle

Orla McAndrew reflects on this important day and speaks to other editors and writers about who inspires them

The Sword and The Stone specialised in an excess of everything, with varying success

Roy "Chubby" Brown

Sitting amidst a rowdy crowd in York's Royal Opera House I anticipated my first encounter with 'The King of Controversial Comedy', northerner Royston Vasey i.e. Roy Chubby Brown.

Script Factor

The Script Factor is held in the studio of the York theatre Royal, an intimate underground performance area with a capacity of around 75 people.

Comedy Night 8

York Theatre Royal's Comedy Night seemed to be offering a line-up that could potentially fulfill such criteria: Patrick Monahan offers the energetic (slightly nauseating) banter; Steve Griffin supplies some of his scabrous Scouse stories; whilst Craig Campbell presents elements of terse transnational respite. Or so we would hope.

Julius Caesar

41 Monkgate, an underused and underrated diamond-in-the-rough of York 's theatrical spaces, was the perfect setting for a production that could have been sub-titled 'Something is Rotten in the State of Rome'.

The Homecoming Revisited

It could be said that the most serious mistakes are to be made in pursuit of the most serious aims. In the past few months I have begun an honest attempt, within these pages and elsewhere, to learn the fundamentals of writing serious criticism.

Bluebird

Who would write a play set entirely in or in the close vicinity of a car? The answer: Simon Stephens.

Bharat Ganarajya 'A Journey through India'

In God's Image

The Christian Union has brought the latest student art exhibition to campus. The show comprises 20 eclectic works which are united by the idea that God created the world and mankind.

Henry James Foy

"I'm worried that if I spend too much time with the doom-mongerers, I might start the intellectual hypochondria nine months early"

Moment of Zen

By James Bithell

Mason's Bistro Bar

If you need to commemorate the end of exams and feel you deserve a touch more class then a night of debauchery in Ziggy's and a Yummy Chicken to celebrate, then Mason's Mediterranean bistro is for you.

Will Heaven

Wine

Are you one of those insufferable bores that still insists on dwelling on the European elections even after the voting has taken place? We at Nouse can help you resist the temptation while still allowing you to make that ever so important political statement.

Social pariah

The XY chromosome: a broken man

Performance aesthetics

Pour Elle

Never has a film been more aptly named. From the opening of Pour Elle (Anything for Her), Julien's every action is governed by his increasing determination to help his wrongly accused wife escape from the justice system which has so dramatically failed them.

Looking for Eric

Ken Loach's new picture sees the renowned social-realist director turn his talents to a more light-hearted and accessible picture.

Il Gattopardo (1963)

Luchino Visconti's Il Gattopardo (The Leopard) is acclaimed as being the centrepiece of Italy's golden era of cinema - and rightly so.

A life in drag

Is classic, comic drag becoming irrelevant? As the definition of 'drag' continues to diversify, Liam O'Brien interviews Dusty 'O', Amber Dextrous and Davina Sparkle about their acts

Dan Le Sac vs. Scroobius Pip

<strong>Estella Adeyeri</strong> interviews the DJ and beatpoet team, Dan Le Sac vs Scroobius Pip.

Bollyworld

Henry James Foy charts the Indian film industry's irresistible journey west

Alexandra Groover

Struck by her unique collection at London Fashion Week,<strong> Liam O'Brien</strong> interviews Alexandra Groover.

Hope. Peace. Soul.

The King Blues' frontman Johnny Fox talks punk and politics with <strong>Estella Adeyeri</strong>.

The God Man

Talking to Daniel Tammet, Sian Turner explores the cryptic world of genius savants

Lucy Kirkwood

Laura Connor interviews the young playwright and Skins writer

Nouse Playlist

Laura Hulley: Kasabian Issac Hewlings: Don Diablo & Example - Hooligans (Nosia Remix) Tom Kellingbeck: Children - "The Power Spirit" Estella Adeyeri: Alessi's Ark - "Over the Hill"

Peter Dobbin: Concept Artist

The ability to create a character or scene in one's mind is rare. To transform that idea into a world on paper is a powerful gift, which Concept Artist Peter Dobbin has developed since his days drawing dinosaurs as a young child.

Sculpting the future of British Art

Antonia Shaw interviews two emerging British sculptors - Candida Powell-Williams and Saatchi Sensation Mark Davey - discussing their work and the challenges that face them
